result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas L Longacre was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Thomas L Longacre was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Cases 15CM1752, 15CM820 or any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel Meeting as stated on Count 5.
No possession of any weapons. Court orders destruction of the weapons used in the crime.
DAY REPORT CENTER - Comply with DRC for 6 Months Consecutive to Jail time on Count 5 and case 15CM937.

No Contact with Bobbi K.B., Jessie M., Jeremiah G., and Marshall T. No Contact with any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. DNA Specimen and surcharge are waived due to date of violation. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. Case 15CM813 is dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation on Count 1.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Cash bail applied paid in full.
WIth Huber. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel Meeting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas L Longacre

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probable Cause Statement
scanned and destroyed
Order denying Huber privileges signed by Judge Aprahamian 5/26/17.

From defendant received 5/24/17 requesting Huber be reinstated.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 5/26/17; Denied - no new factor warranting resentencing and not in the interest of justice.
Maxwell e-signed for Aprahamian

From DRC dated 12/31/16 re defendant's successful completion of program.  Additionally, defendant has not yet completed the Driver's Safety Plan assessment.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 1/3/17.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
From WCS dated 7/27/16 re violation with DRC.
From WCS dated 6/28/16 re violation of defendant in imposed sanction approved by agent.
Filed by defendant.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 MONTHS JAIL; (consecutive to 15CM1752, 15CM820 and any other sentence).

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  
Bobbi K. B., Jessie M. Jeremiah G. and Marshall T.  No contact with victims witnesses listed in criminal complaint. 
*DNA sample and surcharge waived based on date of violation. 
*Attend Victim impact panel as ordered in count 5. 
*No possession of any weapons.
*Destruction of weapons used in crime. 
*Perform 6 months Day Report Center consecutive to jail time on 15CM820 & 15CM937.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be paid as a condition of probation);

COUNT #5:  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

HUBER:  60 days, w/Standard Release Conditions . Sentence to begin forthwith. 

FINE: $1179.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation on Count #1)

DNA SURCHARGE:  waived based on date of violation. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department to be paid.  

D/L REVOCATION: 15 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 15 months;

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  (to be completed as a condition of probation).
Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Sentencing hearing at 12-21-2015 08:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 5.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.  The Court sets the matter for sentencing on a different day to comply with victim notification. Attorney Martinez requests the court grant huber bailiff status.  The State objects to a bail modification.  The Court denies the request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant has recently been charged on 15CM2126 and requesting additional time for negotiations.  The Court sets the matter for another jury status prior to the trial.  Attorney Martinez requests the Court modify the bail to include Huber bailee status with SCRAM monitoring.  The State objects to the bail motion.  The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on:  11/24/15.
Hearing at 11-24-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has just received a new referral. State had a global resolution on all the cases that will change the offer now.  Defense requests to enter a plea today. Court will pass the matter. Case recalled. State addresses the global offer. OWI 2nd addressed. Defense responds. Defense requests another date to review the new OWI case. Court will adjourn the trial. Court will give another jury status/jury trial date on 15CM813. Cases 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along.  Amended Complaint to be filed on 10/12/1015 in file 15CM820.  Hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/8/15.
Hearing at 10-08-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a new case - 15CM1752. Parties are going to work out a global offer. Defense requests the trial date be removed and these matters be set for plea sentencing date in two weeks. Court will reschedule 15CM813 to a new jury status/jury trial date and 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along. Defense requests to address bail on all of defendant's files. Court grants request. Defense is requesting huber bailee status on all four files - 15CM813, 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752. State takes no position. Court grants huber bailee status.  Hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states these cases may resolve if there is a global offer, but requests a date for jury status/jury trial on 15CM813.  Files 15CM820 and 15CM937 to trail along.  Court grants request. Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
with same conditions

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Court orders bail reinstated(not forfeited). Defendant needs to post bail on this matter (15CM813) if not already posted. Atty. Martinez to investigate the bail on this matter (15CM813).  Defense requests another date on all matters. Court will give another date in 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Br. 9 only
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Thomas L Longacre did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts today. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Request denied by Judge Aprahamian as the co-defendant did not request substitution.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or co-actors  listed in the Criminal Complaint. Bail has already posted.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
